benchmark_details.name: CFDLLMBench
benchmark_details.overview: CFDLLMBench is a benchmark suite designed to holistically evaluate large language model performance in Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD), comprising three tasks: graduate-level CFD knowledge, numerical reasoning, and context-dependent implementation of CFD workflows using OpenFOAM.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of CFDLLMBench is to provide a comprehensive evaluation framework for assessing the abilities of LLMs in automating numerical simulations in CFD.

data.source: Curated datasets created from CFD lecture notes, GitHub repositories, and expert-authored content.
data.size: 126 cases (90 CFDQuery questions, 24 CFDCodeBench tasks, 16 advanced FoamBench tasks)
data.annotation: Dataset curated by experts in the field of Computational Fluid Dynamics.

methodology.calculation: Metrics used to evaluate LLM performance include Success Rate, which is the aggregate of code executability, numerical error, and convergence.
methodology.interpretation: A higher Success Rate indicates better execution of simulation workflows and physical accuracy of the results.
methodology.validation: Validated against expert-determined reference solutions and iterative review by domain experts.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Released under the BSD 3-Clause License, free for use and modification.
